definitions.definition: Pertaining to those arts and sciences the study of which is considered to provide general knowledge , as opposed to vocational / occupational , technical or mechanical training.
examples: He had a full education studying the liberal arts.

definitions.definition: Generous ; permitting liberty ; willing to give unsparingly.
examples: He was liberal with his compliments.
Add a liberal sprinkling of salt.

definitions.definition: Widely open to new ideas, willing to depart from established opinions or conventions; permissive .
examples: Her parents had liberal ideas about child-rearing.

definitions.definition: Open to political or social changes and reforms associated with either classical or modern liberalism .

main_definition: ( now rare outside set phrases ) Pertaining to those arts and sciences the study of which is considered to provide general knowledge , as opposed to vocational / occupational , technical or mechanical training.
secondary_definitions: Generous ; permitting liberty ; willing to give unsparingly.
Widely open to new ideas, willing to depart from established opinions or conventions; permissive .
( politics ) Open to political or social changes and reforms associated with either classical or modern liberalism .
